page.title: 17POLICE AT SLAUGHAM MANOR
page.content: Slaugham Manor was built in the 19th century and was changed from a Manor to a hotel just after the Second World War.On the 26 June 1976 it became a hall of residence for single policemen (56) and policewomen(2) who work at Gatwick Airport. The Sussex County Police bought it for a reasonable price.Its purchase saved the rate payers a lot of money.Every policeman has his own room with a bed, cupboard, table,chair,bedlinen,bedsidelamp and mirror. The policemen are allowed to use the old hotel facilites e.g heated swimming pool, bar, ballroom where parties are held ,the Silver room where officers hold their meetings and a room where policemen train with a scale model of Gatwick Airport.The ballroom has a picture showing 9 policemen drinking 9 pints (tea OF COURSE ).
